title: Sampler, 1797
medium:
Medium: silk embroidery on wool foundation
Technique: counted and uncounted stitches; cross and satin stitches on plain weave foundation
creditline: Bequest of Rosalie Coe, from the collection inherited from her mother, Eva Johnston Coe
description:
Floral border enclosing motifs and columns over a verse: 
"Religeon prompts us to a future state
The last appeal from Fortune and from fate
Where God's all righteous ways will be
Declar'd the bad meet punishment and the Good reward.
Elizabeth Glanvell aged 10 years 1797"

tombstone.epitaph:
Sampler, 1797.
1797. Medium: silk embroidery on wool foundation
Technique: counted and uncounted stitches; cross and satin stitches on plain weave foundation. Bequest of Rosalie Coe, from the collection inherited from her mother, Eva Johnston Coe. 1974-42-6.
